page.title: 03Historical contd
page.content: ... meetings were held, but people had to go to the Welfare Hall in Gwaun Cae Gurwen for their entertainment. In the hall there was a cinema, a library, a smaller hall and a children's clinic. There were farms and several cottages on the common and a row of wooden houses between Brook Terrace and St.David's Road. Twenty five years later, the East Pit has gone and open cast mining has taken its place. Today only the VG shop and Post Office still operate. The Curwen Stores and the Doctor's surgery have gone and the two halls are shut. The Miner's Hall is now a coal haulage business. Today tghe village looks a lot tidier. Te common has been fenced in and there are no stray animals. The roads have all been tarmacadamed and have street lights.The houses now have rear gardens and many have been modernised.
